AbstractRange.summary: The AbstractRange abstract interface is the base class upon which all DOM range types are defined. A range is an object that indicates the start and end points of a section of content within the document.

blockquote.para: Note: As an abstract interface, you will not directly instantiate an object of type AbstractRange. Instead, you will use the or interfaces. To understand the difference between those two interfaces, and how to choose which is appropriate for your needs, consult each interface's documentation.
